sense.name: feel sad about, without accepting responsibility
sense.commentary: Note: The experiencer feels bad about something that was outside the experiencer's control.
sense.examples: Prosecutors regretted the court's decision and planned to appeal it to the High Court. The Swiss representative said that his country regretted the nuclear test conducted by China. I regret that I must refuse your kind invitation. We regret to inform you that your manuscript does not meed our needs at the moment.

sense.name: feel remorse for, feel guilty about, entails resposibility for action/situation
sense.commentary: Note: The experiencer feels regret about something the experiencer had control over.
sense.examples: I've regretted my decision from the day I made it. We regret any inconvenience this may have caused you.
